com.example.lunchmeet.lunchmeet

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.lunchmeet.lunchmeet.DBManager

  • public class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The sole point of communication between the rest of the app and Firebase's realtime database.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DBManager getInstance()
        The getter method to return the single instance of the class, as per the Singleton pattern. The instance is automatically created via eager instantiation. Returns the single instance of the DBManager class.
        Returns:
        The single instance of the DBManager class.

      • addUser

        public void addUser(DBUser u)
        Adds a user to the database.
        Parameters:
        u - The user to be added to the database.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(DBUser u)
        Removes a user from the database.
        Parameters:
        u - The user to be removed from the database.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(java.lang.String uid)
        Removes a user from the database, using the UID only.
        Parameters:
        uid - The UID of the user to be removed from the database.

      • getUserFromUid

        public void getUserFromUid(DBListener<DBUser> o,
                           java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves user information corresponding to the given UID from the database. Database information is read asynchronously, so a listener is required to call the proper methods after the read is sucessful. In this case, the user information is collected as a DBUser which is sent to the provided DBListener, which can then run based off that DBUser.
        Parameters:
        o - The DBListener that will process the user information read from the database.
        id - The user ID of the user whose information should be read from the database.

      • updateActiveUser

        public void updateActiveUser(DBUser u,
                             double lat,
                             double lng)
        Updates an active user's location in the database.
        Parameters:
        u - The user whose location should be updated.
        lat - The latitude of the user.
        lng - The longitude of the user.

      • updateActiveUser

        public void updateActiveUser(java.lang.String uid,
                             double lat,
                             double lng)
        Updates an active user's location in the database based on the user's UID.
        Parameters:
        uid - The ID of the user whose location should be updated.
        lat - The latitude of the user.
        lng - The longitude of the user.

      • removeActiveUser

        public void removeActiveUser(java.lang.String uid)
        Removes a user from the active users section of the database. To be used when a user goes inactive (e.g. closes the app).
        Parameters:
        uid - The ID of the user to be removed.

      • attachListenerForActiveUsers

        public void attachListenerForActiveUsers(DBListener<java.util.List<DBActive>> o)
        Attaches a listener to the database to read data about active users from the database. When data about active users is read, the data will be presented as a List of DBActives, which can then be processed by the provided DBListener. This method needs to be called only once, and the DBListener will run its run() method every time the list of active users updates.
        Parameters:
        o - The DBListener that will process the active user information from the database.

      • updateGroupLeader

        public void updateGroupLeader(java.lang.String gid,
                              java.lang.String uid)
        Using the ID of a group, updates the group with the ID of the leader in the database.
        Parameters:
        gid - The ID of the group to be updated.
        uid - The ID of the leader to be updated.

      • updateGroupLocation

        public void updateGroupLocation(java.lang.String gid,
                                double lat,
                                double lng)
        Updates the location of a group in the database.
        Parameters:
        gid - The ID of the group to be updated.
        lat - The latitutde of the group.
        lng - The longitude of the group.

      • updateGroupSize

        public void updateGroupSize(java.lang.String gid,
                            int size)
        Updates the size of a group in the database.
        Parameters:
        gid - The ID of the group to be updated.
        size - The size of the group.

      • removeGroup

        public void removeGroup(java.lang.String gid)
        Removes a group from the database.
        Parameters:
        gid - The ID of the group to be removed.

      • attachListenerForGroups

        public void attachListenerForGroups(DBListener<java.util.List<DBGroup>> o)
        Attaches a listener to the database to read data about groups from the database. When data about groups is read, the data will be presented as a List of DBGroups, which can then be processed by the provided DBListener. This method needs to be called only once, and the DBListener will run its run() method every time the list of active users updates.
        Parameters:
        o - The DBListener that will process the group information from the database.

      • createGroup

        public java.lang.String createGroup(java.lang.String uid)
        Adds an entry in the database pertaining to a new group.
        Parameters:
        uid - The ID of the leader that is creating the group. Every group requires a leader.
        Returns:
        The ID of the group that has just been created.

      • joinGroup

        public void joinGroup(java.lang.String gid,
                      java.lang.String uid,
                      int size)
        Adds a new member to the list of members in a group. Also updates the size of the group with the given size.
        Parameters:
        gid - The ID of the group being joined.
        uid - The ID of the user that is joining the group.
        size - The current size of the group.

      • getMembers

        public void getMembers(DBListener<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> o,
                       java.lang.String gid)
        Retrieves a list of members in the group corresponding to the given group ID. When data about the members is read, the data will be presented as a List of Strings (user IDs) that will then be passed to the DBListener to process.
        Parameters:
        o - The DBListener that will process the member information from the database.
        gid - The ID of the group whose members are being retrieved.
